comment: Loved this class! assignment questions straight from the textbook. Only 2 discussion boards + quiz each week. All quizzes/exams do have to be taken on lockdown but you get 2 attempts for quizzes. Really cares for her students and will work with you. Multiple opportunities for extra credit after each exam which includes answering a few questions.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This class is decent and is not hard if you put in the effort. It does require self-sufficiency, and studying. She gives plenty of extra credit opportunities, and there is weekly homework and a quiz. Put in the work and your grade will show it. She also cares about the students' success and will assist you if you reach out.

I took BIOL1107 online and while I definitely had to put in a good amount of effort to self-studying, it's doable. Prof. Shoja-Taheri is very accessible outside of class, responds to emails if you need help, etc - just make sure you can manage your time to read the textbook/watch lectures/study the questions and you'll be okay.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Loved her! She was so helpful and cares about her students so much. She taught from a PowerPoint but her quiz and super quizzes were almost exactly what she taught. Would definitely recommend her as a professor.

She's a great teacher who clearly cares about her student's success in the class. If you put the effort in and make sure to communicate with her you will do just fine in the class. She also gives great feedback on projects so you know what to do the next time.

Prepare for class by studying PowerPoints meticulously; quizzes and tests align closely with them. Use videos for clarification. Expect weekly quizzes and tests every 3-4 weeks; two quiz attempts with the lowest 2 grades dropped. Wished for more spaced-out assignments since you are teaching the material to yourself and extra credit opportunities.
Although this class may be heavy in studying and note taking, the teacher was very caring.

I'm surprised she has a lot negative reviews. Yes this class is tough but she was very caring and offered a lot of extra credit, as well as dropping quizzes and discussions. I missed a test and she was very understanding and opened it again for me. As well as opening quizzes late for when I was busy with my job. Only issue is the amount of work.

If you have the option to take someone else take someone else. Gives lots of extra credit opportunities. Drops the lowest discussion post, homework, and the two lowest quizzes. There is four tests and a final. The class is hard for the introductory course it is supposed  to be.

There are no trolls, the only reason people are complaining is because she is genuinely that bad. She may be good at her subject but it does not carry over into teaching properly to the online students at all. Very unreasonable amount study time is expected of the student without regard to their own responsibilities and majors.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The hardest intro class I have ever taken. Taking this class at the same time as calc 2 makes me want to switch to a math major, that's how easy calc is feeling right now. Her quizzes are every week, under lockdown browser, and so difficult it makes you feel like you're illiterate. Don't get where the are positive reviews are coming from.

Im convinced the better reviews may be the teacher herself trying to boost her rating. Anyone Ive talked to about this course, classmates and previous students, dont have many good things to say. A lot of extra credit, Ill give her that. But this course is super difficult even when accounting for the extra credit. Your grade will love another class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I loved Dr. Shoja-Taheri. I'm a chem major, but she taught biology in a way that made sense. There was a lot of homework, but her quizzes and exams were VERY similar. She gave 2 attempts for most quizzes/exams (which were online every time). I really recommend her--it was an easy A.

A LOT of homework. She's stated this class is catered to Bio majors but majority of her class is not (this is an intro class and no where in registration does it specify this). Also, she designs the tests in a way that unless you are a bio major, it's going to be very challenging to grasp basic concepts and keep up. Seems nice but VERY challenging.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Do NOT take this class especially if its online. This professor makes sure you wish you'd never chosen any class online ever again. There is a plethora of things to do and this is every single week. If you pick this class get ready to kiss your free time goodbye especially if you have a heavier major. she doesnt have regard for her students time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I had an amazing experience with professor Shoja. I'm not sure where the trolling/negative ratings came from, but she was professional in the lab class. She made sure to elaborate beforehand the experiment and gave excellent feedback. I looked forward to the lab each week.

There are a few reviews that are obviously trolls because Dr. Farnaz is such a great professor. She knows a lot about biology and is literally so sweet. Multiple instances where she gave extra credit/ extended due dates on online quizzes. All quizzes and final is online as well. Her lectures are helpful and she answers any questions you have.
Assigns way to much work and does not respond to emails in a timely fashion
Do not take her class if you want to maintain a decent GPA. She is the hardest professor at this school and thrives on students doing poorly. Assigns work over holidays and weekends.
Assigns way to much work for an intro class

Very challenging professor. Assign tests and homework on weekends. Overall one of the worst courses I have taken at this school. Take Ecore if you can because it's the same credit but way less involved. She acts like she is supper nice and caring but at the end of the day does not care at all and thrives on students doing poorly in her class.
Assigns group projects in an online class and expects recorded group presentations. Never had to do this in an online class before. Seems like a waste of everyones time.
Nice teacher and is good at teaching. Attendance is mandatory she likes to use learning catalytics and do group power points. She has you do homework every week and that's on pearson.
Very lenient and offers a lot of extra credit. If you show up to class you should be fine. She would give us two tries on all of our tests. I would take this class again

She takes pride in her lectures which makes them so interesting to listen to. You will, however, be assigned tests and quizzes over the weekend(There is a lockdown browser). Another thing is that class is not mandatory, but if you miss class you are likely to lose a couple of points. Overall a great teacher and I would take her class again.
She did a good job making sure everyone understood the concepts in the lab

Keep up with your work and you will get an A in this course. Tests and quizzes are generally two attempts and homework is completion grade. You will lose lots of points however if you do not attend classes. The only downside to this course however is that homework and tests are assigned over weekends.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Shoja-Taheri was the best professor for lab. She is really thorough and helpful in all aspects of the lab. She responds to her emails in a timely manner, and provides helpful feedback. Another she does timely is put in our grades! I would definitely recommend taking her if you can. Very nice and knowledgeable professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Shoja-Taheri was a great professor. She always wants to ensure you understand the material and that you are learning. She grades assignments in a timely manner and always makes time if she needs additional help on assignments or lectures. She is a great biology professor, so please take her.

Good lecturer and cares about students succeeding. Flexible with deadlines most of the time. Has weekly homework assignments on Pearson, 10 quizzes and tests + final. Tests are lockdown browser + webcam but you get 2 attempts to look over missed answers. Very easy class if you show up, pay attention, and do the homework. Not a time consuming class

This was my first lab ever, & I am convinced I will never have a better lab professor. Professor is one of the nicest people ever. She is a great teacher and helps you understand the lab while going VERY IN DEPTH. Sometimes she goes too in-depth before lab, which causes it to be longer than it needs to be, but its better to be prepared than not.
She is a very nice and understanding professor. She is a little difficult sometimes, but she walks around to make sure you dont need help and helps you understand the material.

Exams were long and heavy. Do not take with another science course if you can. Your grade was mostly the exams. There was extra credit given and that helped some pass with a C or better. We were NOT given the option to retake any exams

Take her for Microbio Lab ! She offered 2 extra credit opportunities that single handedly brought me from a B to a high A. She can be a bit long-winded and labs can be long but definitely an easy A class if you do the work.

Super sweet, very caring & loving. Lots of reading as u should expected for 2000 level class as well as requirement for pre-nursing major. option to retake 1 test is helpful. groupwork every week but you can do it on your own. extra credit offered. study the ppt and cases studies helps passing the exam. extra reading from the book give u an A
Take her! She is passionate about bio and wants you to do your best. Lectures and powerpoint material can be very heavy but manage your time well and study study study. You will get an A.

SHES THE BEST!!! study for the pre/post quizzes and youll pass. they are soooo easy. some labs were boring but you do get to work with a partner or group so its not bad. there were about 2 labs where we stayed longer than normal time but other than that, finish early, get out early. she helps with literally anything and is so nice. final was EASYYY
such a sweet professor, i loved her. lectures every class, hw is pretty easy, and extra credit opportunities. tests were not that hard in my opinion, just gotta study.

She is seriously such a sweet person. She really cares for her students and is willing to help you with anything you're having trouble understanding. She gives you the opportunity to retake 1 out of the 3 tests you take which is a huge help. If you show up, do the in class assignments, and study her powerpoints for her tests, it is an easy A.

Take this class with her. Point blank take it. She is one of the easiest professors Ive had a Kennesaw. All of her test and quizzes are easy if you study and go to class. She is super sweet and responds to emails quickly. Only thing I didnt care for was the group work, which is weekly.

Great professor, but there was entirely too much group work, it was getting tiring after awhile. She assigns group work in class once a week, so if you skip class you wont be able to do the group work. Homework and quizzes weekly. Lectures were recorded. She sometimes did polls to determine attendance and class participation, so just go to class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Very helpful and nice! We had textbook work every week that would take a while to complete but over all not too difficult. As with any class, lots to memorize but she does a good job to help students understand what's going on. Only thing I didn't like was the amount of group work we did, which was hard to coordinate with people.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects
